item.title: Report X-2024020346
item.description:
Report X-2024020346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process of the sort, the package was dropped on its base. The pressure of the drop caused the plastic pail to split a 2" crack that leaked the solution from the container. DescribePack: There was a 2" diameter split on the bottom of the pail. The solution poured out the pail uncontrollably. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was used to contain the spillage and to alert of the spillage.

OUTSIDE PACKAGING WAS WET DescribePack: CONTENTS ESCAPED FROM BREATHER HOLE IN CAP OF CONTAINER POSSIBLY FROM FREEZING AS LOADS WERE DELAYED FROM SNOWSTORM AND ROAD CLOSURES DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED IN SALVAGE DRUM, REPORTS FILED. 2. X-2024020361 SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO THE UNLOAD TO INSPECT POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. OUTSIDE OF PACKAGING WAS WET. DescribePack: CONTENTS ESCAPED FROM BREATHER HOLE IN CAPS OF CONTAINERS. POSSIBLY FROM FREEZING AS LOADS WERE DELAYED DUE TO SDNOWSTORMS AND ROAD CLOSURES. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACAKGE CONTAINED IN SALVAGE DRUM, REPORTS FILED.

item.title: Report X-2024020334
item.description:
Report X-2024020334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process sort at the station, the package was taken out of the transportation vehicle and there appeared to be wetness on the bottom of the box. Upon investigation, the cap was punctured and leaking with out control. DescribePack: The package had a small 1/8" puncture crack at the cap on the top. This caused the ethyl alcohol to leak from the crack and wet the box containing it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was used to contain any and all spillage and to alert people of the spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024020386
item.description:
Report X-2024020386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was removed from a trailer on doc 11 unload. The item came off the trailer with wet bottom. The manager Jordan Hunter called QA to come retrived the package as he did not know if it was water damage or a leaking hazmat. Joe Mcconnell our QA specialist retrieved the package with gloves, a red hazmat tote and bag. The packages was inspected and found to actually be leaking from the cap. DescribePack: There was no damage to the cap, however, the leaking looks like it came from pressure release due to weather conditions. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pack was put in a hazmat bag and yellow drum. The drum was sealed and put in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020437
item.description:
Report X-2024020437

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: BLAUVELT

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS LOCATED ON BELT 4 ON THE QA PALLET AT 6:45AM. ONCE I OBSERVED THE BOX, THE BOX WAS WET. ONCE I COMPLETELY OPEN THE BOX, I OBSERVED THERE WAS ONE GALLON OF THERMO SCIENTIFIC 80% ETHANOL, FOR MOLECULAR BIOLOGY WITH A LOOSE CAP. BOX WAS PUT IN A RED BIN. NO SPILL ON THE FLOOR. PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE FACILITY WET. DescribePack: THE GALLON HAD LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: NONE

item.title: Report X-2024020261
item.description:
Report X-2024020261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort, the package was being unloaded and there was a distinct smell coming from it. The package handler notified their manager whom contacted the hazmat team which placed the package into a yellow bin under ventilation in the hazmat cage. When inspected it was discovered that the cap was loose with a slow leak. DescribePack: the cap has a slow leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the hazmat cage and placed in a yellow bin and put under ventilation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort a package handler noticed a smell and informed their manager which then the package was placed into the hazmat cage under ventilation. Upon inspection by the hazmat team it was discovered that there when pressure is applied to one of the bottles the cap leaks slowly. DescribePack: The caps on one of the bottles leaks when pressure is applied or when the bottle is tilted. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the hazmat cage and placed under ventilation.

item.title: Report E-2024010396
item.description:
Report E-2024010396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SELKIRK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 01/16/24 at 08:55 hours, an FRA Hazardous Materials Inspector working in the CSX Selkirk Yard reported loaded tank car UTLX 209284, Alcohols NOS, leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV). The car was isolated and the shipper, Cargill, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0116-0040). HEPACO, a CSX Emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and confirmed the initial report of a leaking BOV. Upon further inspection, it was determined product was leaking past the internal ball of the BOV due to a defective component. It was also noted that due to a deteriorated gasket, the BOV’s secondary closure cap was unable to contain the leak. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper-s representative- Daniel Gernant (303-709-1653, Daniel_Gernant@cargill.com). Contractor personnel installed a new gasket on the secondary closure cap to contain stop the release. The car was held at Selkirk pending transload of the contents and certified repair and/or OTMA.
